page.title: 13Landscape near Scremerston.
page.content: Most of the land around Scremerston is farmland.Walking along the roads and pathways we often see lots of wild creatures;rabbits,pheasants,hedgehogs and sometimes roe deer.Alongside the paths and among the hedgerows are many wild flowers and in summer we can find slugs,snails,caterpillars ladybirds and all kinds of insects. There are many different kinds of birds,sparrows,chaffinches,starlings, jackdaws,crows,rooks swallows and gulls. The hedges are mainly hawthorn and there are a number of trees about, some of them forming small woods and shelterbelts and others grown to make the landscape more agreeable to the eye.The trees are mainly conifer but there are whitebeam,sycamore ,elder and elm.Many of the footpaths link farms and scattered houses.
